Read SQL script as statements

Source: R/rdb.gen.R
read_sql_file.Rd

Reads in an SQL script and returns it as individual interpolated SQL statements using split_sql_str().

Usage

read_sql_file(.path, ..., .connection = connect())

Arguments

.path

Path to a file containing SQL statements.

...

Further (named) arguments used as temporary variables available for substitution while interpolating the SQL statements via DBI::sqlInterpolate().

.connection

Database connection as returned by connect(). An S4 object that inherits from DBI::DBIConnection.

Value

A list of DBI::SQL objects.

See also

Other PostgreSQL functions exec_sql_file(), pg_add_default_data(), pg_col_metadata(), pg_col_nr_to_name(), pg_drop_tbls(), pg_has_rls(), pg_has_tbl(), pg_init_aux_tbls(), pg_init_db(), pg_init_main_tbls(), pg_pk(), pg_post_nocodb(), pg_reset_db(), pg_role_pw(), pg_tbl_constraints(), pg_tbl_del(), pg_tbl_keep(), pg_tbl_read(), pg_tbl_update(), pg_update_seq(), split_sql_str()
